channel.title: Snake (Python)
channel.description:
I decided to make the game Snake in python using PyGame
Here is a Video of it (Since most people do not have Python and PyGame installed): http://tinypic.com/r/vorjoj/7
[code]''' Created on Nov 21, 2010
@author: John '''
import pygame import random
pygame.init() font = pygame.font.Font(None, 17) score = 0
text = font.render("Score %d" % score, True, (0, 0, 0), (255, 255, 255)) width = 400 height = 400 screen = pygame.display.set_mode((width, height)) clock = pygame.time.Clock() running = True gameover = False
class Snake: def __init__(self, surface, x, y): self.surface = surface self.x = x self.y = y self.speed = 1 self.dirx = 0 self.diry = -self.speed self.length = 40 self.crashed = False self.body = []
def keyEvent(self, event): if event.key == pygame.K_UP: self.dirx = 0 self.diry = -self.speed elif event.key == pygame.K_DOWN: self.dirx = 0 self.diry = self.speed elif event.key == pygame.K_LEFT: self.dirx = -self.speed self.diry = 0 elif event.key == pygame.K_RIGHT: self.dirx = self.speed self.diry = 0
def move(self): self.x += self.dirx self.y += self.diry
if (self.x, self.y) in self.body or self.x <= 0 or self.x+5 >= width or self.y <= 0 or self.y+5 >= height: self.crashed = True
self.body.insert(0, (self.x, self.y))
if len(self.body) > self.length: self.body.pop()
def draw(self): for x, y in self.body: pygame.draw.rect(self.surface, (0, 0, 100), (x, y, 5, 5), 0)
class Food: def __init__(self, surface): self.surface = surface self.x = random.randint(1,width-5) self.y = random.randint(1,height-5)
def draw(self): pygame.draw.rect(self.surface, (0, 100, 0), (self.x, self.y, 5, 5), 0)
def collision(self, x, y): if x < self.x-5 or x > self.x+5: return False elif y < self.y-5 or y > self.y+5: return False else: return True
fA = Food(screen) fB = Food(screen) s = Snake(screen, width/2, height/2)
while running: screen.fill((255, 255, 255)) for event in pygame.event.get(): if event.type == pygame.QUIT: running = False elif event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN: s.keyEvent(event) screen.blit(text, (width/2, 10)) if gameover == False: s.move() s.draw() fA.draw() fB.draw() if (fA.collision(s.x, s.y)): fA = Food(screen) s.length += 2 s.speed += 0.1 score += 1 text = font.render("Score %d" % score, True, (0, 0, 0), (255, 255, 255)) if (fB.collision(s.x, s.y)): fB = Food(screen) s.length += 2 s.speed += 0.1 score += 1 text = font.render("Score %d" % score, True, (0, 0, 0), (255, 255, 255)) if s.crashed: gameover = True pygame.display.flip() clock.tick(100) print "Score: %d" % score[/code]
Post opinions/highest scores if you can play it.

I’m probably just anal about this, but I feel it’s much cleaner if you program these things in a generic matter, so that modifying anything (like the ‘size’ of a certain entity) would be done properly.

item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“John459, post:8, topic:369776”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=465900.msg3407096#msg3407096 date=1290396700]
As I said on IRC, you should reuse objects, learn proper OOP design, and stop hard-coding sizes and such.

The “reuse objects and learn proper OOP design” suggestions are actually connected. Instead of reallocating each food object (‘fA’ and ‘fB’) once collision occurs, you should simply have a function in the class that re-randomizes its location. Also, you should have the ‘Food’ class invoke a callback function upon collision detection that changes the game state (increases snake’s velocity, its length, and the game score).

The article I gave you on breaking out of nested loops was a proposal submission (a PEP); I mistakenly thought Python provided support for this (how shitty that it doesn’t – even Java supports this crap).

Other than that, it’s ok.
[/quote]

Thank you. item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

I decided to make the game Snake in python using PyGame

Here is a Video of it (Since most people do not have Python and PyGame installed): http://tinypic.com/r/vorjoj/7

[code]’’’
Created on Nov 21, 2010

@author: John
‘’’

import pygame
import random

pygame.init()
font = pygame.font.Font(None, 17)
score = 0

text = font.render(“Score %d” % score, True, (0, 0, 0), (255, 255, 255))
width = 400
height = 400
screen = pygame.display.set_mode((width, height))
clock = pygame.time.Clock()
running = True
gameover = False

class Snake:
def init(self, surface, x, y):
self.surface = surface
self.x = x
self.y = y
self.speed = 1
self.dirx = 0
self.diry = -self.speed
self.length = 40
self.crashed = False
self.body = []

def keyEvent(self, event):
    if event.key == pygame.K_UP:
        self.dirx = 0
        self.diry = -self.speed
    elif event.key == pygame.K_DOWN:
        self.dirx = 0
        self.diry = self.speed
    elif event.key == pygame.K_LEFT:
        self.dirx = -self.speed
        self.diry = 0
    elif event.key == pygame.K_RIGHT:
        self.dirx = self.speed
        self.diry = 0
    
def move(self):
    self.x += self.dirx
    self.y += self.diry
    
    if (self.x, self.y) in self.body or self.x <= 0 or self.x+5 >= width or self.y <= 0 or self.y+5 >= height:
        self.crashed = True
        
    self.body.insert(0, (self.x, self.y))
    
    if len(self.body) > self.length:
        self.body.pop()
        
def draw(self):
    for x, y in self.body:
        pygame.draw.rect(self.surface, (0, 0, 100), (x, y, 5, 5), 0)

class Food:
def init(self, surface):
self.surface = surface
self.x = random.randint(1,width-5)
self.y = random.randint(1,height-5)

def draw(self):
    pygame.draw.rect(self.surface, (0, 100, 0), (self.x, self.y, 5, 5), 0)

def collision(self, x, y):
    if x < self.x-5 or x > self.x+5:
        return False
    elif y < self.y-5 or y > self.y+5:
        return False
    else:
        return True

fA = Food(screen)
fB = Food(screen)
s = Snake(screen, width/2, height/2)

while running:
screen.fill((255, 255, 255))
for event in pygame.event.get():
if event.type == pygame.QUIT:
running = False
elif event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:
s.keyEvent(event)
screen.blit(text, (width/2, 10))
if gameover == False:
s.move()
s.draw()
fA.draw()
fB.draw()
if (fA.collision(s.x, s.y)):
fA = Food(screen)
s.length += 2
s.speed += 0.1
score += 1
text = font.render(“Score %d” % score, True, (0, 0, 0), (255, 255, 255))
if (fB.collision(s.x, s.y)):
fB = Food(screen)
s.length += 2
s.speed += 0.1
score += 1
text = font.render(“Score %d” % score, True, (0, 0, 0), (255, 255, 255))
if s.crashed:
gameover = True
pygame.display.flip()
clock.tick(100)
print “Score: %d” % score[/code]
